summary: Completed frontend testing of Blueview production API integration. All API integration code is correctly implemented. Login form submits to production API, error handling works, toast notifications display, and 401 redirects function properly. Cannot test authenticated flows because production API credentials are not available.

integration_issues.issue: Cannot test authenticated pages (Dashboard, Projects, Workers, Daily Log, Reports) because production API at https://blueview2-production.up.railway.app requires valid credentials that are not available

passed_tests: Login page loads with glassmorphism design
BLUEVIEW branding displays correctly
Email input field visible and functional (data-testid='login-email-input')
Password input field visible and functional (data-testid='login-password-input')
Submit button visible and clickable (data-testid='login-submit-btn')
Demo credentials text displays correctly
Login form submits to /api/auth/login endpoint on production API
API returns 401 'Invalid credentials' for test credentials (expected)
Error toast notification appears with 'Login Failed' title
Error message displays in form ('Invalid credentials')
Toast notification system works with glassmorphism styling
Empty form validation works ('Please enter email and password')
Partial form validation works (email only)
Password visibility toggle works correctly
401 error handling redirects to login page
Auth data cleared on 401 response
Glass card styling visible
Glass input styling visible
Glass button styling visible
All data-testid attributes present on interactive elements

api_integration_verified.error_handling: 401 responses trigger clearAuth() and redirect to /login

action_items: CRITICAL: Production API credentials needed to fully test authenticated flows
The demo credentials (test@example.com / testpassword) shown on login page do not work on production API
Previous admin credentials (admin@blueview.com / BlueviewAdmin123) also do not work on production API
To complete testing, valid production API credentials must be provided
critical_code_review_comments: API_BASE_URL in api.js is hardcoded to production URL - this is correct per requirements but consider using environment variable for flexibility
All pages have proper data-testid attributes for testing
Skeleton loaders are properly implemented in GlassSkeleton.jsx
Toast notification system is well-implemented with glassmorphism design
Error handling in apiFetch correctly handles 401 responses

test_credentials.result: Both return 'Invalid credentials' from production API

context_for_next_testing_agent: Production API integration is correctly implemented. All API calls go to https://blueview2-production.up.railway.app. Login flow, error handling, and toast notifications work correctly. Cannot test authenticated pages without valid production credentials. The frontend code is ready - just needs working credentials to verify full functionality.
rca_of_the_issue: Not a bug - the production API requires valid credentials that are not available in the test environment. The demo credentials shown on the login page (test@example.com / testpassword) do not exist in the production database.
